task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 241°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current view only shows the lower part of the target building; looking up (increasing pitch to 30°) will allow me to see the roof, which is essential for estimating the full height from ground to roof.

Current heading is 0°N, which is away from the target South-West (241°) building; rotating right by 241° will reorient me to face the target, maintaining an upward pitch to view its upper structure for height estimation.

Moving to the front-left node (move id 2) will bring me closer to the target building, making it easier to clearly count the number of floors and observe the full structure from ground to roof for a more accurate height estimate.
